column4: Hey guys, I have a rather urgent problem.. I was playing around with different themes for GDM and one of them was broken, so now it's not displaying the login screen correctly. I tried to access gdm.conf in etc/gdm to enable automatic login and bypass that, but it's telling me that gdm.conf doesn't exist. Help? :(
So does anyone know where my gdm.conf file is or how to revert the GDM back ot its defaults?
/etc/factory-gdm.conf can be copied to /etc/gdm.conf i would imagine
you're welcome. i hope it works.
cp etc/factory-gdm.conf etc/gdm doesn't work, am I doing that wrong?
thanks again :) I make that mistake sometimes
I've heard of that disastrous little command before :P
That didn't work either. :( Double triple checked for typos
well that was my bright idea, not sure what else to do HHP2K
oh for crying out loud, i can't read
